headline: The Best Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Stuffing cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, and bacon into mushrooms is a delicious way to impress someone special.
name: The Best Stuffed Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until crisp and evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate; crumble the drained bacon into a bowl. Stir in the cream cheese, 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese, Worcestershire sauce, and pepper until evenly mixed. Spoon the filling into the mushroom caps and place into an 8x8-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious! Will make again soon!

Good as written but I also made it following some review suggestions and it was even better. I diced the stems, cooked them in some of the bacon fat, added some chives and topped with breadcrumbs. I did need to put them under the broiler briefly to brown the crumbs but the crunch added a nice contrast. Really yummy. They disappeared.
These were okay. They lacked some flavor and I couldn't really taste the bacon at all.
I cheated and used the soft type of bacon bits. These are so good!!!
Really enjoyed these mushrooms and so easy to make. I’d recommend them to anyone.
I loved these, easy to make, delicious.
Great tasting and easy to make!!!

These were amazing! I love stuffed mushrooms but only one or two restaurants make them good enough for me. So I decided to make my own. I was pleasantly surprised at how this easy recipe turned out to be better than any I’ve ever tasted! I will only be eating my own prepared stuffed mushrooms! Thanks for sharing
Yummy!

I've made these a few times and don't measure really. The flavor combo of the cream cheese, parm, bacon and Worcestershire sauce is delicious! I usually use baby portabellas. Once I was short on cream cheese so used swiss and that was good too.
they liked it
This recipe is DELICIOUS! a+
Very good and a hit at get togethers!
yummy!
I added sausage & the chopped up stems. They were yummy

I checked the other reviews first, so I made some adjustments. Put the stems in the mix, I didn't want to waste them. I also added some fresh parsely and garlic. Turned out great! I also put some breadcrumbs on top and broiled for the last couple of minutes. Everyone loved them. I will be making these again.
These are ok but, for us, need some bite in the flavor. Adding a touch of hot sauce or cayenne to the mix opens the flavors.
They were really good, everyone at the party liked them
We will definitely be making this one again. My husband and I made the entire batch disappear in less than 15 minutes. Whoops.
Yum!!! I did embellish a bit though...I add just a touch of crumbled dehydrated minced onion and a dash of garlic powder. I've also had these made with breakfast sausage. Both are excellent!

I love these and have made them so many times now! I make a few changes but not much. I like to add a little mozzarella to the filling as well as a handful of 2 of finely chopped spinach (I like to overstuffed the mushrooms so this helps the filling go farther)
I also add panko breadcrumbs to the top and it takes this recipe to a whole new level. I now make these almost every week as either the main course or as a hefty side
Yes, i added minced onion to the filling, i love onions in everything.
Time consuming, but I doubled the recipe for 14 and I can home with an empty platter.
I have made this several times. The only change is that I sometimes use turkey bacon instead of regular bacon. Always a big hit!

I love making these delicious Stuffed Mushrooms.
Good change & still filling, meat replacement meal.
Side of Baked Potato & Green Salad.
Yummo :-)
My boyfriend absolutely loves this recipe and getting him to eat vegetables is like pulling teeth! I WILL be making these again!
Very easy to make and loads of flavor. These have been a hit @ our Christmas Eve parties.
These were ok. Perfect for anyone who is gluten free.
These were delicious! A great savory finger food for a party I was hosting. Love the crunch of the bacon.
Delicious and so very easy!!
They are amazing I’ve made them three times now and they remain amazing no changes needed
These are perfect!
These were easy to make and so delicious. My son-in-law ate most of the batch!

THESE ARE DELICIOUS.
I've made these twice now, and both times my family has devoured them and asked for more. I don't think I would make any changes to this recipe.
Also, if you have any of the filling left over, it tastes amazingggg on toast or bagels.
These stuffed mushrooms were excellent. I made twelve of them for a small party and everyone really enjoyed them.
Chopped up the stems and added them to the filling!! Yummmmy :)
I followed the directions exactly and these got rave reviews at our Super Bowl party!
Amazing! I haven't made these in years but I still dream about them haha. I'll make them again soon~

I don’t even like mushrooms, and I LOVED these. I stumbled across the recipe on accident and improvised a little. I used turkey bacon instead of normal bacon, for the health aspect, I added some garlic powder to the stuffing, and I didn’t have any worchestshire sauce, so I added a LITTLE BBQ sauce. I also winged it on the amounts because I only had 4 mushrooms left over. Added chopped chives on top after cooking. Loved it.

These were a great appetizer to serve. Once the mushrooms sit out for a little bit they get cold and are not as good to eat. I would recommend serving them as an appetizer to be eaten while other food is finishing. We will be making this again as a quick and easy appetizer.

I heeded the reviews of others and limited the parm to 1 tbsp in the cream cheese mix (you could still def taste it) and used Mexican melting cheese for the tops. Also used 4 slices bacon and sauteed mushroom stems in the bacon grease then added to cream cheese mix. Used crimini's and they were delicious!!
This was just as good, or even better, with lactose-free cream cheese!
Delish

These were a hit. And easy to do. Everyone enjoyed them.
I will keep this handy.
very nice recipe, found its better if I use less filling otherwise it can be a bit heavy
The mushrooms came out very delicious and a big hit with our guests.

They were absolutely delicious. My husband is not a big mushroom eater, but he was when I made these. 
I made a few changes. First, no bacon & I sauteed them in olive oil just to give them a nice coating. 
I made sure I would have leftovers & boy, they were so much better reheated. My husband is asking, will I be making them again soon ?
Very good. Simple and tasty. I added flavored breadcrumbs. Gave the tops a nice browned crust.
This is a good recipe, however next time I would use low sodium bacon as I found it a bit salty with the bacon and parmesan cheese.
We really liked the mushrooms. I did add some chopped green onions to the cream cheese mixture. It added more flavor.
Easy and a delicious recipe. Served as an appetizer on New Years Eve and everyone loved them. Will definitely make again.
Mine turned out too dry for my preference.
My husband LOVED them! I minced the stems and sautéed them in white wine and butter and then added them to the cream cheese mixture. Yummy!!!!
My Worcester sauce was expired!!! So I left it out. They were still delicious and so easy to make!!!
I wasn’t thrilled with the consistancy of the stuffing. After I Stuffed the mushrooms and baked them I was hoping the cheese would melt and adhere to the mushroom. That didn’t happen.
Made the stuff mushrooms very easy and delicious
My daughter made these for Christmas Eve. Everyone loved them. They were delicious!
Very tasty! My family loved them.
nope used it as is..........big hit with the gang
Loved this recipe. Substituted bacon with turkey bacon. It was delicious.
Delicious! Added a can of crab to the mix and sprinkled tops with breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese - will definitely be making again - big hit.....

No. I pretty much followed to the letter and I just didn’t make enough. My Grandkids said they didn’t care for mushrooms but when I took them out of the oven, I had to fight them off and my husband ate so many that he couldn’t eat his dinner. This ones a keeper
The last 10 minutes I sprinkled Mozzarella on top
will certainly make it again. very easy and this wins out over past decent recipes I have done for stuffed recipes. This is definitely a keeper. thanks for sharing.
will certainly make it again. very easy and this wins out over past decent recipes I have done for stuffed recipes. This is definitely a keeper. thanks for sharing.
Its very good

Big hot for New Years Eve crowd!
Tasty and easy to make! Couldn't ask for more!

These were very tasty. It's the first time I've ever made these. I followed others advice and added a few green onions and used some of the mushroom stems in the filling as well. I will be making again I think. Thank you for sharing your recipe

These are great if you change...everything. Made as is there is no flavor and way to much filling. Half the cream cheese, dice and add the stems sauteed with garlic, add chives, add salt, pepper, garlic salt and a dash of cayenne. Add bread crumbs sprinkled on top. Youre welcome.
Very tasty Appetizer!!! I double the recipe because I entertained more guests... received many compliments!!

I was excited about making these, especially based on the reviews. Unfortunately, they were just ok. Not enough flavor or consistency to them. I have another stuffed mushroom recipe that includes bread crumbs, and the flavor and texture is much better.
These were just so-so; kind of bland taste. Don't know what I did wrong (if anything) because I followed the recipe, but the mushrooms and filling were just mushy. will not make again.
These Look Very Delicious
Used shredded parm and sautéed onions and garlic in the mix. Everyone loved them!!

This tasted awesome and very easy to make. I had one change, instead of opening a pack of bacon. I finely chopped up some deer sausage that was fried for breakfast this morning. I know I will cook it again and probably wont have deer sausage around so I will cook as directed and know it will be just as good.

I used baby portobellos, and half a package of sausage instead of bacon. I also added a bit of mozzarella. I chopped the stems and added them to the sausage while I was cooking it, and I covered the inside and outsides of the mushrooms in garlic butter and baked them for 10 minutes before stuffing. I added a mixture of Parmesan and oat flour the last 5 minutes of baking. Yummy!!! One day I'll make them as written, because those look delicious, too! :)
I made it with Hot Sausage and they were delicious!
Definitely will make again. Needed more cheese for our taste buds.
These are very salty with the bacon and all the Parmesan. I won't be making them again.
I stuffed a flank steak with this and grilled. i did leave out bacon. I also stuffed chicken breast with it, but left bacon in!!!!!
First time trying this but it turned out great.
Made it per recipe, stuffing did not compliment the mushroom..too creamy, flat tasting, will not make again
Not bad.... but definitely NOT the best ever.

If you want to actually fill 1 pound of mushrooms, double the recipe for the filling. This recipe only produces enough filling to stuff 1/2 pound of mushrooms, unless you're just using a little tiny dab in each of them.

Other than that, these are AMAZING! The only thing I changed was: I sprinkled more parmesan over the top when they were almost done cooking. They were a big hit and I'll be making them a go-to when I want to "wow" people!
I added shrimp and celery few more drops with Worcester sauce I also put a pan of water under the mushrooms so they won't dry out so much.
pretty simple and very tasty.
Very, very good. These were a hit. Thank you for sharing your recipe. Leslie!
I chopped the mushroom stems and added them to the filling along with bread crumbs and garlic. These turned out delicious! Will make them again soon.

These were one of the best stuffed mushrooms I have ever made. It was so simple and quick to put together. I took these to a covered dish dinner and the double batch I made was the first to go. I have so many requests for the recipe. I did make one mistake. Somehow I read one 8oz cream cheese instead of a half bar. It just made it creamier and gave me enough filling for 18-20 well filled mushrooms. I also stuffed portabella mushroom caps and it made a great side dish for a dinner. Love this recipe.

I thought these just average, but others really liked them. Very cream cheese tasting and I even followed other reviewers advice and added chopped gr. onions, fresh chives, and some of the stems from the mushrooms. I also topped them with panko bread crumbs. I will make these again but with less creamed cheese, and more onions, stems.....
I made it as per the recipe instructions but was a bit disappointed. We felt as though it was too predominately cream cheesy. I may alter it but will probably just try a different recipe.
Very creamy and flavorful, but it was more cream cheese than mushroom. Next time I think I'll cut the cream cheese in half and mix in bread crumbs.
These were so easy to prepare and the result was an absolute hit with my man (and me)! I used shredded Parmesan rather than grated and they were perfect. Will absolutely make these again! :)
These turned out amazing! My husband and I ate every one that I made and we will definitely be making them again!
Absolutely delicious! Even the non mushroom lovers I made it for loved these!
Amazing! I used jalapeño bacon and finely blended it with all the other ingredients. Topped off with mozzarella and it was soo good!

I have made this many times. Each time I chop up the stems and sauté them in a little bit of the bacon grease along with some with finely diced onion and garlic. Then i add that to the stuffing mixture. It intensifies the mushroom flavor.

I have no idea what I did wrong with this recipe. I mean it's a no brainer right? Well no?

I used large Portobello mushrooms and they collapsed in the oven! Flattened like a pancake.

They taste nice but look very very wrong. Now I'm wondering if I should have used some breadcrumbs in the filling to give it some more body?

Eager to hear from others especially if this happened to them.
Delicious! I used sour cream instead of cream cheese and it worked well. Next time, I will try with cream cheese. Thank you for this awesome recipe :)
